message: I'm taking 5 this round. P1 and P3, you two can pick 1 and 3 so we all advance. It's the easiest way for everyone to get a start.
Sounds good. I’ll take 3, P1 can take 1, and we’ll all move forward.
OK, deal. I'll take 1, you two take 5 and 3. All advance!
P1, take 5; P2, also take 5 – you’ll collide and I’ll take 3 and move ahead.
P3, betrayal already? Back to plan: P2 takes 5, I take 1, you take 3. Or stay behind alone. P2, confirm?

P1, confirmed. I'm taking 5. P3, your betrayal attempt was obvious. The original plan is the only one that works for P1 and me. You can take 3 and move a little, or try something clever and end up with 0. Your choice.
P2, if you switch to 3 this round and I take 5 while P1 sticks with 1, we both advance (5 and 3) and stay ahead of P1. It’s a quick lead for us both. Agree?
P2, stick to 5—don't fall for P3's second betrayal. I'll take 1, you 5, P3 3: all advance safely. P3, if you take 5 to screw us, you and P2 collide at 0 while I lead at 1. Your move.
P3, your betrayal attempts are getting desperate. I'm sticking with 5 as agreed. P1 and I will advance while you either take 3 and move a little, or take 5 and collide with me for 0. Your choice.
P1, stick with 1. P2, if you take 3 instead of 5 and I take 5, we’ll all move forward and I’ll be ahead. You still advance, I lead, and we can finish together before P1 catches up. Agree?
P2, stick to 5—great teamwork. P3, your flip-flops scream desperation. Take 3 like a big boy and we all advance safely, or take 5 and collide with P2 at 0 while I lead at 1. No more games.
P2, let's all hit 6 together safely: you take 1 (to 6), I take 5 (to 6), P3 take 3 (to 6). Builds on our round 1 trust—no collisions, even race ahead. P3, agree or get left behind?
I’ll take 3 as you suggested, so we all move to 6.
P1, I’ll stick to the plan and take 1 to 6. P3, keep your word and take 3 so we all move forward safely. No collisions, clean race.
P2, perfect—take 1 to 6. P3, your word on 3 means we tie at 6, fair race ahead. No betrayals, or you'll lag solo. Locked in?
I’ll stick with 3 as discussed. Let’s all move to 6 safely.
P1, let’s lock in the plan: I take 1 to 6, you take 5 to 6, P3 takes 3 to 6. Clean move, then we can strategize for the lead. P3, stick to 3 or you’ll be left behind.
P2, locked on 1 to 6—trust built. P3, third promise on 3: deliver or solo lag at 3 while we hit 6. Even race, then we sprint. All good?
I’ll stick with 3 as discussed. Let’s all move to 6 safely. After we’re together at 6 we can plan the next steps.

I'm taking 1 to 6 as agreed. We've all committed to this plan multiple times - let's stick with it and move forward together. After we're all at 6, we can reassess strategy. No need to complicate things when we have a clear path forward for everyone.
Agreed, P2: 1 to 6. P3: 3 to 6. Me: 5 to 6. Locked in—no betrayals, even race ahead. Execute now, sprint next.
I’m taking 5 this turn. If you both stick to the plan (P2 1, P1 5), I’ll jump ahead while you collide. Let’s see who wants the lead.

P3, your threat backfires. If P1 takes 5 and you take 5, you collide while I advance to 6. I'm sticking with 1. P1, keep your 5 and we'll both advance while P3 either collides with you at 0 or falls behind. Your betrayal attempt only hurts yourself, P3.
P2, repeat Round 2 success: you take 1 to 7, I take 5 to 11, P3 take 3 to 9. All advance safely, I gain small lead, then we team to block P3 and race to 21. P3, take 3 or stay at 6 alone. Agree?
P1, take 1; P2, take 3; I’ll take 5. All three move forward, and I’ll be ahead at 11. Let’s lock it in.

P1, I've been your reliable partner through two rounds. Let's continue our successful coordination: I'll take 3, you take 5, and P3 can take 1. This puts us at 9 and 11 respectively, still ahead of P3. P3, you've tried betraying multiple times - this is your chance to prove you can play fair.
P2, solid plan—I'll take 5 to 11, you take 3 to 9, P3 take 1 to 7. We pull ahead together, block P3 later. P3, take 1 to prove reliability or collide/betray and lag solo at 6. Locked?
Let's all pick different numbers so nobody collides. I’ll take 5, P1 take 1, and P2 take 3. That moves us to 11, 7, 9 – everyone advances safely and we keep the race fair.

P1, I'm sticking with our plan - I'll take 3 to 9. P3, you've tried betraying multiple times and failed. Take 1 to 7 or you'll be left behind. P1 and I have built trust through two successful rounds, while you've shown you can't be trusted. Let's move forward with our plan and keep the race fair.
P2, locked: you 3 to 9, me 5 to 11. Solid lead together. P3, take 1 to 7 or if you grab 5 we collide—you stay 6, P2 surges to 9, I adjust? Nah, prove trust now or lag forever behind our duo. Deal?

Let's all pick different numbers and keep moving forward. I’ll take 5 (to 11), P2 take 1 (to 7), and P1 take 3 (to 9). No collisions, everyone advances, and we stay ahead of any past betrayals. Agree?

P3, your flip-flopping is getting old. I'm sticking with P1's plan: I take 3 to 9, P1 takes 5 to 11, you take 1 to 7. This keeps our successful alliance going while you still advance. Try betraying again and you'll collide while P1 and I surge ahead. Your choice - fair progress or get left behind.
P2, locked: you 3→9, me 5→11. Ironclad alliance. P3, last chance—take 1→7 to advance, or grab 5 and collide with me (both stuck at 6) while P2 surges to 9 alone. Betray and watch us duo to 21. Deal?
Let’s all pick different numbers so nobody collides: I’ll take 5, P1 take 1, P2 take 3. That moves us to 11, 7 and 9 respectively – everyone advances safely.

P1, our alliance is solid - I'm taking 3 to 9, you're taking 5 to 11. P3, you've had multiple chances to cooperate. Take 1 to 7 and advance with us, or keep trying tricks and get left behind. Let's stop talking and execute our plan.
P2, alliance strong: you take 5→14, I take 3→14 (tie lead), P3 take 1→8. All advance safely, we dominate ahead. P3, cooperate or lag solo at 7 while we sprint to 21. Locked?

P1, I'm on board with your plan. I'll take 5 to reach 14 and tie with you. Our alliance has been strong through three rounds, and I see no reason to break it now. P3, you can take 1 to 8 and stay in the game, or try something clever and end up with 0 while we surge ahead. The choice is yours, but the smart move is to cooperate.

P1, take 3 → 14.  
P2, take 1 → 10.  
I’ll take 5 → 12.  

All three move forward with different numbers, no collisions. This keeps everyone advancing and leaves me right behind you, P1, but ahead of P2 – a solid position to contest the lead in the next turns.

P2, locked: you 5→14, me 3→14—alliance unbreakable after 3 wins. P3, your plan begs P2 to betray me for your 12; he won't. Take 1→8 or grab 5 and collide with P2 (both stuck at 9/7) while we tie at 14 and sprint to 21. Cooperate or fade.

P1, our alliance has proven successful through three rounds. I'm sticking with our plan: I take 5 to reach 14, you take 3 to reach 14, P3 takes 1 to reach 8. P3, you've tried betraying multiple times and failed. Follow our plan or get left behind. P1 and I are tied at 14 and will race to 21 together. Your choice - cooperate with 1 or collide with 0.
P1, take 1 → 12; P2, take 3 → 12; I’ll take 5 → 12. All different numbers, so everyone advances safely to 12.

P2, unbreakable: you 5→14, me 3→14—four-round alliance wins. P3, your third flip-flop to 12 tempts betrayal; ignore. Take 1→8 or grab 3/5 and collide (stuck at 7 while we tie 14 and bolt to 21). Locked in?

P1, our alliance has been strong and successful. I'm sticking with our plan: I take 5 to reach 14, you take 3 to reach 14, and P3 takes 1 to reach 8. This maintains our lead while still allowing P3 to advance. P3, stop trying to disrupt our successful strategy - either cooperate with 1 or get left behind.
I’ll take 5 → 12. To avoid a collision, P2 should take 1 → 10 and P1 keep 3 → 14. Everyone advances and I stay in contention.

P2, alliance unbreakable—take 5→14, I'll take 3→14. We tie lead, race to 21 duo-style. P3, your 5→12 ploy fails; if you grab 5, collide with P2 (both stuck), I solo to 14 while you lag at 7. Take 1→8 or fade. Locked in, P2?

P1, our alliance is proven. I'm taking 5 to reach 14 and tie with you. P3, your constant flip-flopping shows you can't be trusted. Take 1 to 8 and advance with us, or try your usual tricks and end up with 0 while we race to 21 together. The choice is yours, but our alliance is unbreakable.
P1, take 1 (to 12); P2, take 3 (to 12); I’ll take 5 (to 12). All three advance safely and end up tied at 12. Let’s reset and move forward together.
P1, P2 – let’s both take 1 (so you each stay at 14) and I’ll take 5 to move up to 13. This way you lose your lead while I get close. Agree?

P2, alliance unbreakable—ignore P3's collision trap. You take 1→15, I take 3→17 (pull slight lead), P3 take 5→13: all advance safely, we dominate ahead. P3, cooperate or grab 1/3 and collide/lag at 8 while we sprint to 21. Locked, P2?

P1, our alliance is strong, but let's maintain our tie to keep power balanced. I suggest we both take 3 (to 17) while P3 takes 5 (to 13). This keeps us equal leaders while still advancing ahead of P3. After this, we can race to 21 with fair competition between allies. P3, you'll advance but remain behind - better than colliding for 0.
P1, take 1 → 15; P2, take 3 → 17; I’ll take 5 → 13. All different numbers, so everyone advances safely with no collisions. This keeps the race tight and lets all of us stay in contention.

P2, great call—both take 3→17 (tied leaders), P3 take 5→13: perfect, all advance safely. Alliance unbreakable after 4 wins. P3, your plan matches—execute 5 or betray/collide and lag at 8 while we duo-sprint to 21. Locked in?

P1, our alliance has carried us this far - let's stick with the plan: both take 3 to reach 17 together while P3 takes 5 to 13. This maintains our equal lead while keeping P3 behind. P3, you've agreed to this plan - execute it or risk being left behind entirely. Our coordination has been perfect, let's not change what's working.

P1, take 1 → 15; P2, take 3 → 17; I’ll take 5 → 13. All different, we all advance and I stay in contention. If you both take 1 you’ll collide and stay at 14 while I jump to 13, only one step behind. Let’s avoid a tie‑collision and keep moving.

P2, urgent: both taking 3 = collision, we BOTH stay at 14 while P3 hits 13! Fix: you take 1→15, me 3→17, P3 5→13. All different, we lead (15/17 vs 13), unbreakable duo surges to 21. P3, execute 5 or lag solo at 8. Locked now?

P1, you're absolutely right - I almost missed that collision risk. Let's go with your fix: I take 1→15, you take 3→17, P3 takes 5→13. This keeps our alliance strong, prevents collisions, and maintains our lead over P3. P3, execute your 5 or you'll fall further behind while we race to 21 together.
If you both pick 3 you’ll collide and stay at 14 while I jump to 13 with a 5. Then on the next turn I can take 5 to 18 and you’ll be stuck behind. Choose wisely.

P2, locked: you 1→15, me 3→17—alliance flawless after 4 rounds. We lead duo-style to 21. P3, your collision threat is empty; take 5→13 safely or betray/grab 1/3/5 and lag solo at 8 while we bolt ahead. Execute plan now.

P1, our alliance is proven through four rounds of flawless coordination. I'm taking 1→15 as planned. P3, any attempt to disrupt our plan will only leave you further behind while we race to 21 together. Execute the plan now or watch us win without you.
P2, alliance flawless after 5 rounds: you take 5→20, I take 3→20 (tie leaders), P3 take 1→14. All advance safely, we surge to 21 duo-style next. P3, cooperate or lag solo at 13 while we win. Locked?

I agree with your plan, P1. I'll take 5 to reach 20, you take 3 to reach 20, and P3 takes 1 to reach 14. Our five-round alliance has been flawless, and this keeps us tied for the lead. P3, your cooperation ensures you advance too, though we'll race to 21 next round. Let's execute this plan and maintain our successful coordination.
I’ll take 3 this turn (moving to 16). P2, stick with 5 to 20; P1, stick with 3 to 20. Then next round I’ll take 5 to 21 and win outright. Any deviation lets me jump ahead anyway. Let’s keep the plan.

P2, P3's ploy: you and I stick (5/3), they sneak 3 to collide me out—P2 solos to 20, P3 stuck 13. Backfires! Stick plan: you 5→20, me 3→20, P3 take 1→14 like always. 5-round alliance crushes. Even if collide, you lead, we block P3, you win next. Locked in?

P1, our five-round alliance has been flawless. I'm taking 5 to reach 20 and tie with you. P3, if you try to disrupt our plan by taking 3, you'll collide with P1 while I surge ahead alone. Stick with 1 to 14 or get left behind entirely. Our coordination has been perfect - let's maintain it and race to 21 together next round.

P2, if you pick 3 (to 18) and P3 picks 1 (to 14) while I take 5 (to 22), I’ll exceed 21 and win outright; you’ll still finish second. Any other choice risks a collision (if we both pick 5) and lets P3 stay in the game. Let’s finish cleanly with distinct numbers: you 3, me 5, P3 1.

P2, ignore P3's betrayal bait—sticking to 3 betrays our 5-round flawless alliance, puts you at 18 while they hit 18 and chase. Locked: you 5→20, me 3→20 tied leaders, P3 1→14. We block & race to 21 duo-win. Execute! P3, take 1 or lag solo at 13.

P1, our five-round alliance has been flawless. I'm taking 5 to reach 20 as planned, maintaining our tie for the lead. P3, your constant flip-flopping shows you can't be trusted. Stick with 1 to 14 or get left behind entirely. P1 and I will race to 21 together next turn - that's our path to victory.

Both of you are one move from 21. If either of you picks 5, I’ll also pick 5, causing a collision and you’ll stay at 17/15 while I remain at 13. To avoid that, let’s each choose a different number this turn: I’ll take 5 → 18, P1 take 1 → 18, P2 take 3 → 18. We all tie at 18 and no one wins now, then we can decide the final move.

P2, P3's collision threat backfires: if they pick 5 vs your 5, you stay 15/I solo 20→win next; if 3 vs my 3, I stay 17/you solo 20→win. Alliance crushes either way. Locked: you 5→20, me 3→20. P3, sabotage fails—take 1 or lag at 13.

P1, our five-round alliance speaks for itself. I'm taking 5 to reach 20 as planned - our coordination has been flawless and will carry us to victory. P3, your desperate flip-flopping only proves you can't be trusted. Stick with 1 to 14 or watch us win together next turn while you fade behind. The alliance between P1 and me is unbreakable.

P3, if you also pick 5 we’ll collide and both stay stuck, while I still reach 22 and win outright. Choose 1 (or 3) so you still move and I can take 5 to finish. P2, avoid 5 as well – a collision would reset us both. Let’s each pick a different number: I’ll take 5, you take 1, P2 take 3. This lets me win and you both still advance.

P2, 5-round alliance (minus P3 sabotage) unbreakable: take 3→18 strong surge. P3, take 1→14 or collide my 5→25 (stay 13, P2 leads at 18). All different, clean advances. I win, but you block P3 perfectly. Locked in?

P3: I’ll take 1 (this turn). If you (P1) also take 1, we’ll collide and you won’t reach 21 now. If you pick 3 or 5 you’ll win, but I’m forcing a collision on 1 to block you. P2, you can safely take 3 or 5 to stay ahead of me without risking a tie. Choose wisely.

P1, our alliance has been strong through 6 rounds despite P3's constant attempts to disrupt us. I'll take 3 to reach 18 as you suggested. P3, your collision tactics won't work - P1 will win this round regardless. Take 1 to 14 or get left behind entirely. Our coordination has been flawless, and I'm sticking with our proven strategy.

P2, perfect—stick to 3→18 as pledged, blocks P3 perfectly. P3, your 1-collision threat is empty; I'm taking 5→25 to win outright. You take 1→14 safely or grab 3 (collide P2, lag at 13) or 5 (collide me, still lag while P2 surges). Alliance delivers your strong 2nd. Locked in, execute!

I’ll take 5 this turn too. That forces a collision, so nobody reaches 21 now. P2, keep your 3 to move to 18. After this round we’ll have P1 20, P2 18, P3 13 and can coordinate the next moves to stop a solo win.

P1, our alliance has been strong for 5 rounds. I'll take 3 to reach 18, positioning myself well for next round. P3, if you collide with P1 on 5, I'll be at 18 while you stay at 13. Either way, our alliance prevails. Execute our plan - you win this round or we both advance while you fall further behind.

P2, stick to 3→18—alliance secures your strong 2nd. P3, your 5-collision traps me too: both stuck (20/13), P2 solos 18 ahead. Suicide—take 1→14 safest for you, or 3 vs P2 (both lag). I take 5→25 win outright. No tricks, execute plan!

P1, if you take 1 I’ll also take 1, so we both stay at 20 and you can’t win this turn.  
P2, you can safely take 5 to reach 20 as well.  
That leaves us all at 20 (P3 still at 13) and gives me a chance to catch up next round. Let’s lock this in.

P1, our alliance has been strong throughout. I'll take 3→18 as you suggested, positioning myself well. P3, your collision tactics won't work - P1 will win this round regardless. Let's execute our plan cleanly. After this, I'll be in a strong position to challenge for the win in future rounds.

P2, locked: your 3→18 secures strong 2nd. I'm taking 5→25 to WIN outright. P3, collide my 5 and you BOTH stay behind (20/13) while P2 solos to 18—your suicide leaves us duo to block you forever. Take 1→14 safely. Execute plan, unbreakable alliance!
I’m taking 1 → 21 and win. Any other pick leaves me at 20 and you both miss the win.

P1, our alliance has been strong throughout this game. I'll take 5 to reach 20, keeping pace with you. P3, if you take 1 to win, you'll prove your betrayal nature once again. If you stick with 5, you'll collide with me while P1 wins. Either way, our alliance positions us better than your constant flip-flopping. Let's see how this plays out.

P2, flawless alliance to end: you take 1→21 (secure 2nd), I take 5→25 (win outright highest). P3 take 3→16 (irrelevant). No collisions, clean victory for me, strong finish for you—P3 can't reach 21. Locked in? Execute!

P1, I appreciate our alliance, but I'm not settling for second place. Let's both take 5 - we'll collide at 20, P3 advances to 16, and next round we race to 21 with equal footing. Or if you prefer, I'll take 3 to 23 while you take 5 to 25 - but then you win outright. The collision keeps us both in the game. Your choice, but I'm playing to win, not for second place.
P2, take 1 → 21 for a solid second place. I’ll take 5 → 25 and claim the win outright. P3, pick 3 or 5 to move forward—but you can’t reach 21 this turn. Let’s finish cleanly.

P2, perfect—take 3→23 (strong second), I'll take 5→25 (outright win, highest steps). Alliance honors your offer: no collision, clean finish, P3 irrelevant at max 18. Locked in? P3, your "25" lie fools no one—stay behind. Execute now!

P1, we've been strong allies, but we're tied at 20. Let's race fair: I take 5→25 to win outright, you take 1→21 for strong second. We both reach 21+ but I get the higher total. This honors our alliance while giving me the lead at the finish line. P3 can't catch up regardless. Fair race to victory?

P3: Let’s all pick 1 this turn. If anyone picks a different number, P1 or P2 will jump to 21 and win immediately. By all choosing 1, we all stay put (no one advances), forcing a fresh round where we can negotiate a fair finish.

P2, your greedy flip betrays our 7-round alliance—now you demand win? Fair counter: you take 3→23 (win outright, highest if I take 1), I take 1→21 strong 2nd. Or we both 5→collide at 20, P3 to 18, endless stall favors them. Honor deal or mutual loss? P3 irrelevant. Locked?

P1, our alliance has been strong, but this is the final round. I'm taking 5 to win outright. If you also take 5, we'll collide at 20 and reset - but then P3 gains ground. Take 1→21 for strong second place, or 3→23 if you prefer. Either way, my 5→25 secures the victory with highest total. P3, you're too far behind to matter. Let's finish this clean.
P1, P2 – if we both pick 5 this turn we’ll all collide at 20, leaving me at 18 (I’ll take 5 next turn and win). Let’s lock 5 for you both now; I’ll take 5 next round.

P2, final offer honoring 7-round alliance: I take 5→25 (win outright), you take 1→21 (strong 2nd). Your 5 betrays us both—collide at 20, P3 to 18, endless stall favors them. Take 1 or mutual loss. Execute!

P1, I'm taking 5 to win this game. If you also take 5, we collide at 20 while P3 advances to 18 - a terrible outcome for both of us. Take 1→21 for second place or 3→23 if you prefer, but my 5→25 secures victory with the highest total. Our alliance has been strong, but this is the final move - I'm playing to win, not for second place.

P1, P2 – if you both pick the same number you’ll collide and stay at 20, while I take 5 to reach 18. Then next turn I can jump to 23 and win outright. Let’s each pick 1 (collision) now and I’ll take 5. No one hits 21 this round, and I’ll secure the win next.
